newsitem.title: USA: U.S., Thailand discussing satellite cooperation.
newsitem.headline: U.S., Thailand discussing satellite cooperation.

text.p: U.S. and Thai defence officials are discussing the possible sharing of U.S. satellite information with Thailand, but no decision has been reached, the U.S. Defence Department said on Friday.

"Recent stories in the press of proposed U.S.-Thai cooperation on satellite use are somewhat inaccurate," Air Force Lt. Col. Queenie Byars, a Pentagon spokeswoman, told Reuters in response to questions. She declined to say whether sensitive intelligence satellites were involved.
According to Thai newspaper reports, Thailand is trying to cut its budget and is seeking an arrangement under which it would receive regional defence intelligence information from U.S. satellites.
The reports have suggested that the information would be provided without charge, but the Pentagon declined to provide details.
"The Department of Defence has held preliminary discussions with the royal Thai military regarding cooperation in military satellite communications," Byars said.

"A Defence Department team visited Thailand in early January to discuss this issue further. As discussions on possible cooperation are on-going, it would be inappropriate top speculate on their outcome," she added.
